Posts.Content: Hi sur1999 I would like to read your story. I am currently waiting for lumpectomy and a sentinel node surgery in a couple of weeks. This is stage 2 oncologist said radiotherapy and tamoxifen after. I worry about the pathology report.
Posts.Title: My sister. needs postive messages from people who are in the same...

Posts.Content: Thanks No its ER+ as you mentioned. Surgery is 15th of August though presently the lymph nodes are clear. I am also having pains around the breast area hence part of my worry thinking worst case senario. But why mention treatment plans when it could change? It's it a bit misleading? Thanks
Posts.Title: My sister. needs postive messages from people who are in the same...

Posts.Content: I read somewhere the initial result from biopsy may change. I want my results to remain already knowing that rads and tamoxifen are my treatment as discussed with onculogist
Posts.Title: My sister. needs postive messages from people who are in the same...

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for taking the time to explain. It makes a lot if sence.  I feel a lot calmer bow.
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you very much for the positive stories. It helps a lot
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Just been told I have 17mm cancer lump in my left breast. The consultant states that my lymph nodes appear to be clear. I am now waiting for lumpectomy surgery in 3 weeks. I am scared the lump could spread due to my nides due to time I have to wait  I am also concerned that I still have to wait for another 2 weeks to get results after the surgery . Why another agonising wait. Does it mean that initial result could change? I am so worried. Does anyone have a similar experience?
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for taking the time to explain. It makes a lot of sence.  I feel a lot calmer now
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you for so much. That's reassuring to know. The word cancer is harrowing to say the least.
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Michelle. It was a grade 2 ductal....i have not been able to tell anyone to date but I have to sum up the courage to do so soon. I just need to gather myself and be on top of things first. I will definitely visit a local group for support.
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: This is exactly how I'm feeling right now my elderly parents. But I'm getting there. Thank you
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: I finish a 3 week rads for ER + no lymph involved left breat in mid november and due to see a consultant on the 10th of january. Can anyone tell me what i'm likely to expect at this appointment.
